description: Test of English as a Foreign Language (Academic Context)
curriculum_standard: Based on TOEFL iBT Writing Section Requirements

topic_coverage.summary: Focus on academic synthesis and independent argumentation.

categories.name: Category 1: Independent Task (Opinion)
sub_topics: Education (Co-ed vs Single-sex, Online vs In-person)
Lifestyle (City vs Countryside, Money vs Happiness)
Technology (Impact on social skills, Reliance on computers)
example_prompts: Do you agree or disagree: It is better to work in a team than alone.
Should university education be free for everyone?

categories.name: Category 2: Integrated Task (Reading + Listening)
sub_topics: Art & Literature (Analysis of movements, Author theories)
example_prompts: Summarize the points made in the lecture, explaining how they cast doubt on the reading.
Explain the professor's solution to the environmental problem described.

vocabulary.level_requirement: Academic Proficiency. Subject-specific vacabulary (biology, history, etc.).

complex_structures: Synthesizing structures (The lecture contradicts the reading by stating...)
Concessive Clauses (Even though, Despite the fact that)
grammar_focus.sentence_variety: Mixture of compound-complex sentences to show relationship between ideas.

writing_standards.structure: Integrated: Intro -> Point 1 -> Point 2 -> Point 3. Independent: Intro -> Body -> Conclusion.
writing_standards.scoring_points: Topic Development, Organization, Language Use (Accuracy & Complexity).
